name: Forss House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one night in this very comfortable, luxurious, understated 4star hotel. The location with the Forss river running through it, made it really special for me as did the terrific cuisine.
reviews.title: Forss House is highland hospitality at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay in this charming place was exemplified by the attention given to to us by Ann , our host, who is a very special lady and a real credit to the establishment and the team.
reviews.title: A cool reception
Wonderful stay
reviews.text: May the Forss be with you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front-of-house lady who checked us in when asked if we could have a snack (3pm) informed us that this was impossible as the kitchen staff were busy prepping for dinner and 'didn't you stop on the way?'. No apology or offer of anything! I have never experienced this in any hotel anywhere in the world. Apart from this the hotel was what one would normally expect.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, warm welcome.

reviews.text: We stayed one night only, in the Cairnmore room in the main house. The house itself is lovely, a large gracious staircase, lovely panelled bar, welcoming dining room, lovely breakfast in the conservatory on the side of the house. Our room was huge, with a bathroom attached from a private small corridor. Luxury indeed. Most hotels would have shoehorned an ensuite into the corner of our bedroom, and created two saleable rooms, but not here. This is not a "boutique hotel" offering, it is more like staying in someone's very comfortable, welcoming country house with great staff. The welcome was everything others have said - Anne is a true delight, warm and professional, friendly and available for all your needs. She directed us to a lovely walk past the waterfall in the grounds, along the river to the sea, which was exactly what we were after. When taking our orders on the bar before dinner she skilfully talked my boyfriend into having a totally different starter and main to his original thoughts, but he absolutely loved them. The quality of the food was the equal of much more expensive stops on our tour of the Highlands (including the much famed Albannach), which was a very pleasant surprise. We played a relaxed game of scrabble after dinner, until Anne had to close the bar at 11pm. Very quiet, we had a lovely night's sleep and a good quality breakfast in the morning. Unfortunately the location means we don't have an excuse to go back anytime soon, but if you are in the area, this is a wonderful choice.
reviews.title: Outstanding hospitality - super !!!

reviews.text: We had a birthday celebration here in May 2011. The private dining room was perfect with a rectangular shaped table where it was possible to talk to everyone. The venue and setting is fantastic. We were able to bring our own music - nothing was a problem for the staff. The food was excellent and the service was very efficient.
reviews.title: Fantastic venue for a private party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent venue all presided over by the very capable Anne.
reviews.title: A genuine country house hotel with real style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great venue - not just for a private party but also for a quality meal out.
reviews.title: Didn't live up to expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is how it should be. Charming, not super smart, with good wooden doors and slightly scuffed furniture. Large bedrooms with antique furniture and fireplaces, and modern large bathrooms. Excellent food served by charming local waitresses. Cosy bar with a huge selection of whiskies. Best of all is the sparky manageress who manages both you and the hotel with verve and wit - and who realy does know her whiskies
reviews.title: Comfortable and Relaxing

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night and had high hopes after seeing the lovely pictures on the website, but sadly the hotel did not live up to this for us.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected

reviews.text: Not really too much on offer around Thurso, so I landed on Forss House...the TA reviews were good.
reviews.title: A lucky find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was glad to make this my base for a couple of days - much to explore in the region.
reviews.title: Can be summed up easily

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was one of the king-bedded rooms in a purpose built row, and it had just been freshly redecorated. It smelled new, and all the linen and furnishings complemented the style of the place - a little bit old, and a little bit new. Eclectic is the word. The ensuite bathroom had everything desired though not to five star standard. The grand home is lovely, and my reception was warm and friendly. didn't see in-house guestrooms. Free wifi in reception too!!! (insert applause here).
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in for dinner each night rather than driving a few miles back to Thurso. Food delightful (could have managed bigger helpings though!) and well served in the formal dining room. Breakfasts were great - freshly cooked, and with fresh orange juice! The grounds surrounding Forss House are peaceful and I wandered far - to the sea, actually, which is beautiful here and there are ruins to check out.
reviews.title: We´ll come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all, worth the stay. I will go back if I'm in the area again.
reviews.title: touch of luxury

reviews.text: Forss House is a welcome retreat in this somewhat isolated area of Scotland. We had an extremely warm welcome to our cozy rooms. Our rooms were located in one of the buildings in the garden, and I would recommend that location. In particular, the bathrooms were very nice, and clearly had just been recently redone. They were clean and warm and had great lighting...and I am super-picky about hotel bathrooms. My only small niggle would be that I wish the beds had duvets and more substantial pillows. Didn't love the sheet and blanket set-up, as the blanket did look well-worn. But we slept well in our quiet room. Breakfast was also good, although service could have been a bit quicker. However, these are small matters, and the overall experience at Forss House is a very good one, and you should stay without hesitation.
reviews.title: Thoroughly recommend

reviews.text: My daughter and I recently visited family in Thurso - we found Forss Hotel on Trip Advisor and were delighted with our stay. Ann and her staff welcomed us into the lovely old home which has been converted into a comfortable, traditional hotel tucked into beautiful countryside and salmon river. The Caithness area of Scotland is very beautiful and harkens back to a different time - the Forss experience complemented this in many ways. We would highly recommend this gem in the north!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: First time visit, in almost tropical weather! Hard to believe it was the north of Scotland.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Thurso

reviews.text: An excellent hotel, with a very large comfortable room and bathroom with good service and food. Dinner and breakfast was extremely good, apart from my wife's porridge which was what I imagined Oliver Twist's gruel must taste like. Maybe it was an off day?
reviews.title: Fab-u-lous!

reviews.text: Incidentally, the worst Black Forest Gateax I have ever eaten was actually in the Black Forest itself, and now the Worst Porridge Award goes to Forrs House Hotel! Spooky, eh?
reviews.title: Serenity and style

description: Forss House is a delightful 1810 country home nestling in 20 acres of woodland, below a waterfall, on the gently meandering River Forss. A 14 bedroom family owned hotel Forss House is an elegant comfortable haven that puts you instantly at ease with a welcoming staff keen to look after you.
